nodes.bodyText: You should just negate it and include this in the if-statement above.

Never use == when comparing doubles, due to floating point errors, this is a very unreliable operation.
You should instead do sth like distance <= 0.05 or so.
The name "ogDamage" seems rather un-intuitive.

Why are you doing this?
Also seems quite wasteful to round it and then compare it with ==, should instead use a threshold.
Or since you seem to want to always have at least a damage of 1 you can just use Math.max(1, damage) instead.
This "instanceof LivingEntity" check is redundant, you are already doing this in the Predicate above.
Also this .IsValid() method should be moved to the Predicate
.distance() is a rather expensive operation and not really needed for this purpose, should rather use .distanceSquared() and then calculate the damage based on that.
I have no idea how can I use squared distance instead
Why are you rounding the damage here?
Because a double value can be infinite, and from what I've heard doing equations with those cause problems(exceptions).
You are already performing a min operation on that, so this being infinite is infinitely impossible.
This check should probably happen wayyyyyyyy earlier. Best would be in the Predicate itself.
Nah it shouldn't because we want knockback and explosion effect for the main target too.
Also should probably override the validation method for this, since we don't want negative or zero ranges.
This is a boxed int, null check needed.
Explosion particle for every entity in the AOE? Surely this should just be in the actual centre.
Can you rename this "n" variable. It's very nondescript.
This is a cancellable event. Also, like most events, this is a pre-damage event not post. So, move the damage down, make sure it isn't cancelled and then make sure the damage is actually correct.
I'm not sure I understand this fully. Can you elaborate a little?

If a plugin wants to change the damage or even cancel then this is what should happen. Right now you aren't letting this happen.
You need to fire event, check if cancelled, if not, then damage(e.getDamage());
Empty line.
